poem:
Title: "A Storm Comes East"

Snowfall whispers in the north while
Rain's insistent argument
Inundates Gulf coast breaths.
A cyclonic waltz, spinning East,
Unsettles certainty even in sleep.
Our cities, small dolls in winter's clutch,
Await the quiet of the snowfall's touch.
Drape the dawn in white, silence me,
Winter, in your icy tranquility.
